data.title: Great for meetings!
data.text:
We held two days of meetings here for a group of ~35.  The meeting space was very comfortable, and the food was amazing!  Typical of my boss, we changed our plans on the fly several times throughout each day, and every request was met with a smile and a can-do attitude.  They even brought a server from the restaurant to privately take dinner orders from my boss and his team, when he decided to "host" an ad-hoc dinner meeting.
The conference rooms we used were secluded in a corner away from other guests, with a foyer that allowed for comfortable movement between sessions, as well as a place for catering and seats for dining.
My group included attendees from all over the US and Asia, and included some vegetarians.  The chef was able to accommodate several requests for meals outside of the standard catering menu, and it was all delicious.
The guest rooms were also very comfortable.  Reasonably spacious, current and clean...even the tv was easy to operate!
Several of our guests offered compliments on my choice of location.  I love it when other people make me look good!
Note:  You'll want at least some of your folks to have cars, as there's not a lot to do in walking distance.  The hotel does have a shuttle, which helps.

owner_response.author: Stephan M, General Manager at Hyatt Regency Aurora - Denver Conference Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear jennifergrove,

Thank you for your review and five star rating. I'm so glad your meeting was accommodated well and we were able to impress your team! We love hearing positive feedback about our banquet food and service and your comments have been shared with the staff. We would love to welcome you back for another meeting in the future if the opportunity presents itself. 

Warmest Regards,
Stephan Meier
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: An excellent experience 😊
data.text:
From the moment I made my reservation  I knew this was going to be a great experience. I received an email reminder the night before with online check in so I could let them know my expected arrival time . They emailed me when my room was ready so I was able to check in after landing at the Airport and picking up my rental car. It was only a 20 minute or so drive. 
     The room was beautiful,very clean and the bed and linens were extremely comfortable. 
     Customer Service at the front desk,valet parking and dining were all fantastic. 
     Both my early dinner and breakfast was delicious as was my Happy Hour $5.00 glass of wine ! 
     Also the workout room was state of the art and very enjoyable to use. 
     The only unexpected downfall was having to pay for parking but it will not stop me from staying there again. In fact I am staying there the night before I fly out.

owner_response.author: Stephan M, General Manager at Hyatt Regency Aurora - Denver Conference Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Leroygardencat,

Thank you so much for your five star rating and kind words. I'm so glad your stay was pleasant and hassle free from beginning to end. As a brand new hotel we love hearing feedback like yours because it inspires us to keep our standards as high as possible and drives us to do everything we can to give our wonderful guests the five star experience they deserve. We look forward to welcoming you back next time you're in Aurora.

Warmest Regards,
Stephan Meier
General Manager

data.title: The BEST!!!
data.text: I've been staying here almost weekly since they opened.  I watched the build.  Longed for a restaurant and a quiet, "Spandex-Free" adult venue.  This is IT!  I commute weekly and have for 18 mos.  The staff are AWESOME!  I would put them up against any global hotel I have stayed at in the past 10 years.  Including the Ritz.  They are that good.  And so is the GM...Stephan.

owner_response.author: Stephan M, General Manager at Hyatt Regency Aurora - Denver Conference Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

So great to hear from you on TripAdvisor! Your recommendation and kind words are truly appreciated and we love having you as one of our esteemed repeat guests. It's our pleasure to continue to provide you with the best possible experience during your stay with us and we look forward to welcoming you back time and time again. 

Warmest Regards,
Stephan Meier
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: made my business trip even better
data.text:
Clean and spacious, I enjoyed my initial arrival and then also each day when I returned to the hotel from my work location. My co-workers and I had a dinner there (mine was excellent), and I had four breakfasts there (also excellent). I have dietary restrictions, and the kitchen accommodated my requests fully each time. I also would like to say thanks to the breakfast server team, whose members were always smiling and friendly and attentive.

Here are three minor quirks: 
- There seems to be no direct walking line from the parking garage. I often parked on the first garage level (easy to do when the hotel isn't busy), and I had to walk over the gate median to get to the front walkway. When I parked on a garage upper level, the elevators took me down to a lobby in the garage ground floor, and then you have to walk around to the right. But the exit door is not well marked, so it was a little bit confusing (for me and one other stranger guest).

- I use Apple Maps on my iPhone. I noticed sometimes the directions had me travel to the hotel via the main road out front, but sometimes the directions had me travel through the neighborhood behind the hotel. The neighborhood does not look anything like a hotel area, so it's a bit confusing. A co-worker had warned me of this, so when I drove through the neighborhood I wasn't overly concerned about being lost, but new visitors should make sure to first access the hotel via the main road.

- My room had a glass wall separating the toilet from the sink. In the middle of the night, at low light, the glass wall is barely visible. I didn't have the misfortune of walking into it, but I had to continually remind myself to look for it. I actually thought about sticking a piece of reflective tape on it to increase its visibility, but of course I didn't have any reflective tape.

Overall a great experience, and I would be very happy to stay here again.

owner_response.author: Stephan M, General Manager at Hyatt Regency Aurora - Denver Conference Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Craig W,

Thank you so much for your review and five star rating! Comprehensive reviews like this one are invaluable to a new property so I thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts. I'm so glad you enjoyed your dining experience and your stay overall. You are correct about some online mapping services not pinpointing our exact location. This comes with bring a brand new building with a new address and we are working on making sure every service has our precise location and will not mislead our guests. Once again, thank you for sharing and we hope to welcome you back next time you're in Aurora.

Warmest Regards,
Stephan Meier
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Outstanding hotel
data.text: This is a very clean hotel. The employees there are truly the cream of the crop. They strive at all times to make sure the guests are well taken care of!!!!  I am required to have a special diet and the kitchen and wait staff made sure the food that was served met my dietary needs.

data.title: not impressed
data.text:
Cons- paying for parking ($12) at a suburban hotel was unexpected. Bed frame is a huge box that is larger than mattress--- watch your shins! Not enough towel bars or hooks in bathroom. Coffee station in room  blocks view of tv from bed. Desk set up is awkward. Extra charge for "high speed" internet. 
Pros-bed was comfortable, room on 9th floor was quiet 
Overall- I would stay at the nearby competition if I need to stay near the medical center again.

data.title: Great Stay
data.text:
I recently stayed at this hotel while traveling on business.  The hotel has a great gym and the staff is super friendly and helpful.   The internet was very fast, both wi-fi and ethernet and there were no charges for this.  The hotel has a happy hour and the food was decent.  My room was very clean and designed well (great bed, furniture, bathrooms and huge TV).

This hotel was only 5-6 months old.  I was super pleased with my stay and would stay there again.   The hotel has a parking garage that is $12 a day (self park) and $19 a day (valet).

My only suggestion would be to have a more convenient location for smokers other than going out front.

data.title: First Stay at a new Hyatt Regency in Denver
data.text: Although I typically stay at one of the downtown Denver Hyatt hotels, I decided to try the brand-new Hyatt Regency Aurora-Denver last Sunday. I was very pleasantly surprised by the high level of finishes there, both in the common areas and my hotel room. The staff were all very friendly -- Anelia at the front desk was very gracious and provided a great Diamond Upgrade that was very comfortable and spacious (my daughter joined me to watch the Broncos game). Michael at the bar was very pleasant and helpful with a a late "to go" lunch. The location appears to be well-placed to serve the nearby local Anshutz Medical Center and, while on the eastern edge of Denver, is likely popular with meeting planners due to the proximity to the light rail system which provides good access to both downtown and DIA. As I was there on a quiet weekend, there were no meetings in the conference center but the hotel is likely quite active during the week. I look forward to my next stay at the Hyatt Regency Aurora-Denver Conference Center.

I certainly hope we have the opportunity to welcome you back next time you're in Aurora!

Warmest Regards,
Stephan Meier

data.title: Great place to relax.
data.text: The hotel room is clean and quiet with comfortable beds.  The linens are clean white and not the dingy white. The staff was friendly and helpful with transportation to the airport.  Earlier in the week I stayed at another "H" hotel in Cherry Creek and I was very disappointed with their rooms.  It is located just off the highway and near the hospital.  This hotel is definitely worth checking out even though it is not in the downtown area.

data.title: nice hotel, great service, but remote from anywhere
data.text: The hotel seems brand new, as does the area around it. It has nice amenities, including bathrobes in the room - one of my favorite amenities - and the staff was extremely nice.  My only gripe would be that it is far away from just about anything.  We were there for a conference and wanted to grab lunch away from the venue, and had to pile into cars to go a a few miles to a mall with a bunch of chains. Other than that, no complaints at all.  In fact, for a conference or business meeting, this is a good place.

data.title: Has potential but a few flaws as well
data.text:
This hotel was very clean and new and the front desk staff were friendly and welcoming. I arrived early (11am) and was hoping for an early check-in but was told that there were no rooms available, which is completely understandable. I asked when they thought that a room might be available and they said around 12:30 and that I would have to check back with them at that time. I decided to sit and wait in the hotel lobby until that time and I noticed that, a bit before 12:30, one of the employees approached a customer sitting nearby me and offered for him to check into a room/informed him that a room was now available. I did not appreciate this arbitrary approach to assigning newly-cleaned rooms (in fact, upon arrival, one of the front desk staff told me that early check-in was "first-come, first-served). What would make a lot more sense to me would be if they would take down your phone number in the order of arrival and text each person, in order, as rooms became available. This strikes me as a far more fair process.

The room itself was clean and spacious. My major qualms were the following: 1. The shower was extremely poorly designed...It is an open shower with a glass panel that extends for half the length of the shower, with the other half open/walk-in. This would ordinarily pose no problem except for the fact that the non-adjustable shower head sprayed water so far, such that the water was spraying beyond the covered portion of the glass onto the bathroom floor. Each time I showered, I had a HUGE puddle to clean up which required me to use multiple towels. 2. The hairdryer was so loud that it was deafening. I legitimately felt like it was a hazard to my ears. I understand that hotels cannot afford to get fancy hairdryers but I would strongly suggest seeking out a more quiet hairdryer. 

Finally, my biggest complaint is that my room was never cleaned (other than upon arrival, of course). I stayed for 2 nights and when I arrived back on the second evening I found that my room had not been cleaned. I double-checked that I did not have the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door, which I did not. I went down to the front desk to ask why my room was never cleaned and the response I received was less-than-satisfactory. The woman at the front desk said "I'm sorry, that's weird, we have you down for two nights so your room definitely should have been cleaned..." She asked if I would like my room cleaned at the time (it was 4pm) and I told her that I had just had a stressful day on business and that I wanted to spend the rest of my day resting in my room. I therefore made it clear that I did not wish to have my room cleaned that late in the day and I was disappointed that it had not been done earlier. She said she "would definitely mention it to somebody" but was not apologetic. I do not think this is acceptable. To add insult to injury, 5 minutes later a member of the housekeeping staff knocked loudly on my door (multiple times) while I was on an important business call. Keep in mind this is after I explicitly requested to be left alone for the remainder of the evening. When I tried to tell her that my room had not been cleaned earlier in the day but that I did not wish for it to be cleaned now, we had a long, drawn out conversation that was going in circles because she did not speak English. I obviously don't blame the housekeeping staff member because she was trying her best but I think there is a breakdown in communication between the hotel staff as I really did not wish to have my room cleaned so late in the evening. 

If the hotel were to fix the aforementioned issues I think it would be a nice place to stay.

owner_response.author: Stephan M, General Manager at Hyatt Regency Aurora - Denver Conference Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear ElleGC008,

Thank you so much for your review. Reviews like yours are vital to our mission to provide the absolute best possible experience for all of our guests while they are staying with us. While most times early check ins are available on a "first come first serve" basis there are instances that guests with Hyatt status or those who have checked in online would get priority and I apologize this was not properly explained to you. There is no excuse for your room not being cleaned and housekeeping disturbing you during an important call and I greatly apologize for this. It's not a proper representation of our high expectations for ourselves and your comments have been used as an example to better train our staff. We would love the opportunity to welcome you back when you're back in Aurora and we can give you the proper service you deserve.

Warmest Regards,
Stephan Meier
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: New Hotel, Well Appointed, Few Negatives
data.text: I was at the Hotel for a work conference so I wasn't the one who chose the hotel.  the Hotel is new and very well appointed.  The rooms are very contemporary with nice furniture a great bed and a large TV.  The bathroom had very nice stone counters and  contemporary open shower stall.  The lobby is really open and clean along with a very nice conference area.  A couple of areas for improvement - the "shelf" by the TV obscures the TV from one half of the bed.  The food at the conference was just OK.  There is no Jacuzzi and the pool area was closed.  My big issue at the hotel was marijuana smoke coming into my room through the ventilation system.  I understand this is Colorado where recreational use of marijuana is legal but i don't want someone else's smoke coming into my room; this is after all a no smoking hotel.  I told the front desk and they sent security up to my floor.  They were able to smell the marijuana but could not locate its source.  After about an hour or so, the marijuana smell in my room subsided.  The drug smoke issue happened both nights of my stay.  On the second night the hotel offered to move me but it would have taken a lot of work on my part to pack up all my stuff at 10pm to go to another room.  I was disappointed that was their only solution or offer of restitution.  If I had my kids with me I guess I would have had to move.  There needs to be a better way for the hotel to track down drug users in their hotel that are affecting guest health.

owner_response.author: Stephan M, General Manager at Hyatt Regency Aurora - Denver Conference Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear lorenwebb,

Thank you so much for your review and feedback. As a brand new hotel we rely on feedback like your to address issues and propel our guest satisfaction to the highest possible level. I'm glad you found the hotel well appointed but concerned about the marijuana smell you experienced in your room. It's obviously a hindrance to a pleasant stay  and I'm sorry we could not find a better resolution. We are absolutely a non smoking property and that includes marijuana. I can assure you this is strictly enforced as our guests health and satisfaction are of our most utmost concerns. If you are ever back in Aurora we'd appreciate the opportunity to welcome you back and give you the experience I know we're capable of. 

Warmest Regards,
Stephan Meier
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Hyatt Experience
data.text: We stayed there few nights with a 10-months-old baby for a family trip. The hotel is very beautiful and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They even allowed us to checked in around noon to unload a full luggage of baby stuffs with home-made baby foods. A play yard was already set up in our room when we checked in. The house keeping service was super fast whenever we asked for extra stuffs. I will definitely come back next time!

data.title: Ritz Carlton like service
data.text:
I was here for a very large convention where more than 20,000 people attended.  The Hyatt is VERY conveniently located literally across the street from the convention center.  I was EXTREMELY surprised to see how well kept up and run this hotel was given the massive amounts of people that run in an out - literally.  

The drive in was very large and accommodated drivers, taxis, peditaxis, and ubers easily.  Check in was extremely quick.  On check in I had slightly mixed results.  Jessica was very professional and thorough covering everything from directions, points, etc.  My initial check in person was sweet but not thorough.  

The Altitude restaurant was well run.  The restaurant manager, Chris, used to work at Disney and his attention to making everything beyond wonderful showed.  The only thing he didn't do was to tell me to have a magical day --- lol.  At the restaurant, Anisette got us coffee instantly, Dani was our waitress and pleasant.  The $18.00 buffet was as good at what was being charge by the Four Seasons where I stayed just a few weeks earlier, but at 2.5 times less!  Casey chatted with me very politely as she made a great Omlette.

The Regency Club, the concierge's club, was excellent.  Well kept up and staffed.  

The room was very updated, clean and in great condition.  Electrical sockets were everywhere from the desk to each side bed table.  Cleaning ladies were in and out quick and thorough.

This hotel is wonderfully managed and well kept.  This was a pleasant surprise being a convention center hotel!  Stay and enjoy!

owner_response.author: Stephan M, General Manager at Hyatt Regency Aurora - Denver Conference Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear RobertRSanAntonio,

Thank you for your review! I'm sorry to say that your glowing review is posted to the incorrect property. I'm happy you had a great stay at the Hyatt Regency Denver at the Colorado Convention Center, they are truly a wonderful property and a great asset to the Hyatt family. If you're ever in Aurora we'd love the opportunity to welcome you to our property and show you what we have to offer.

Warmest regards,
Stephan Meier
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response
